- [ventoy/Ventoy](https://github.com/ventoy/Ventoy) ★73324 [`arm64`] [`auto-install`] [`bootable-usb`] [`bsd`] [`chromeos`] [`iso-files`] [`legacy`] [`linux`] [`multiboot`] [`persistence`] [`secure-boot`] [`uefi`] [`unattended`] [`unix`] [`usb`] [`windows`] [`x86`] [`x86-64`]  
  Ventoy是一个免费、开源的工具，允许用户将任何ISO映像文件（如Windows安装镜像、Linux发行版、游戏ISO等）直接挂载到USB驱动器上，无需修改BIOS或使用特殊工具。它使用Python编写，并利用了EFI引导规范，允许用户在无需重新安装操作系统或其他软件的情况下，轻松地在USB上启动各种操作系统或应用程序。Ventoy支持多种类型的ISO映像文件，并提供用户友好的图形界面。

- [mpv-player/mpv](https://github.com/mpv-player/mpv) ★33117 [`audio`] [`c`] [`ffmpeg`] [`mplayer`] [`mpv`] [`multimedia`] [`video`]  
  mpv是一个基于MPlayer和MPlayer2的跨平台开源媒体播放器，旨在提供高质量、简洁的解码与渲染体验。其核心功能包括完整的音视频解码支持（H.264、HEVC、AAC、MP3等）、精准的帧跳转与字幕渲染、可配置的硬件加速以及网络流媒体播放。用户可通过命令行控制，也能通过配置文件（mpv.conf）或脚本实现自定义快捷键、自动调整图像滤镜、音量平衡等细节设置。mpv对插件热加载友好，可直接在运行时动态添加或移除滤镜与功能扩展，满足多样化使用场景。  
  
技术实现方面，mpv主要用C语言编写，利用FFmpeg实现解码、libass负责ASS/SSA字幕渲染，SDL2或Wayland为默认图形输出。项目将渲染流程拆分为解码线程、音频线程、视频渲染线程，并通过libmpv API提供给开发者用于嵌入或调用。Lua脚本语言被广泛用于插件和UI定制，脚本可访问视频信息、播放状态并直接操作播放器行为。整体架构高度模块化，支持Linux、Windows、macOS、BSD等多平台编译，保证跨平台一致性体验。

- [openssl/openssl](https://github.com/openssl/openssl) ★29260 [`cryptography`] [`decryption`] [`encryption`] [`openssl`] [`ssl`] [`tls`]  
  OpenSSL 是基于 C 语言的开源加密与安全传输库，提供对称/非对称加密、哈希、签名以及完整的 TLS/SSL 协议栈，已被服务器、浏览器和嵌入式系统广泛采用。库分为 libcrypto（核心密码算法）与 libssl（TLS/SSL 封装），并包含 openssl 命令行工具，支持证书管理、协议调试与加解密测试。实现依托可移植 C 代码和针对 CPU 的优化内核，使用自研 BIGNUM、AES、RSA、ECC、SHA 等模块完成算法运算。开发者可通过头文件 API 在应用中直接调用加密功能，或利用工具链生成自签名证书、执行协议模拟。

- [facebook/zstd](https://github.com/facebook/zstd) ★26278  
  Zstd是一种无缝压缩库，提供比gzip更高压缩比、远快速度，支持多线程并行压缩/解压，能够动态调整压缩级别。核心用C实现，模块化为压缩引擎、字典、流式API，并利用SIMD向量指令与哈希匹配优化性能。库自带命令行工具、内存映射压缩以及Python/C#/Rust等语言包装，兼容现有zlib接口。适用于服务器日志归档、网络传输、嵌入式存储等多场景。其简洁易用的API支持64位系统和POSIX，字典功能可在小样本里显著提升压缩效率，常用于机器学习模型与图像缓存等应用。

- [cxasm/notepad--](https://github.com/cxasm/notepad--) ★8600  
  Notepad is a lightweight, cross‑platform text editor built with Python and Tkinter, targeting developers and casual users who need a simple but functional interface for editing plain text. The application launches a single window featuring a resizable text widget, menu bar, and optional status bar. Core functions include opening, editing, and saving files of any type, plus a quick print dialog. Search and replace are available via a modal dialog that supports plain text or regular expressions. The editor automatically tracks unsaved changes and warns on exit, while a line‑numbers panel and a dynamic word‑count display offer basic code‑editing aid. Underlying modules separate concerns: 'ui.py' creates the Tk widgets and handles events; 'file_ops.py' encapsulates read/write logic and error handling; and 'utils.py' provides helper functions such as path resolution and dialog wrappers. The project makes optional use of the Pygments lexer library to enable rudimentary syntax highlighting for supported languages. Dependencies are minimal, limited to the standard library and an optional 'pygments' package that can be installed via pip. Source code is organized in a clear, modifiable structure, making it straightforward to extend features such as multi‑tab support, theme switching, or custom keybindings.

- [muan/emoji](https://github.com/muan/emoji) ★2270 [`emoji`] [`search`]  
  符合多浏览器与多平台的表情符号处理工具，提供统一的短代码（:smile:、:heart:等）↔ Unicode 解析与渲染。核心功能包括：  
  
- **短码解析**：将带有冒号的表情名称自动转换为对应 Unicode 字符。  
- **平台映射**：根据平台（Apple、Google、Microsoft、Twitter）返回相应的图标 URL 或 SVG，支持自定义绘制资源。  
- **反向查询**：从 Unicode 字符或图标 URL 获取短码及标准名称，方便日志和翻译处理。  
- **批量替换**：一次性正则扫描文本，替换所有匹配的短码，支持正则自定义过滤。  
- **自定义扩展**：可插入自定义表情、别名或禁用列表，满足企业内部符号库需求。  
  
技术实现以 TypeScript 为主，借助 Node.js 运行时，使用 ES6 模块化和 Babel/Webpack 打包；核心映射数据采用 JSON 结构，提供高性能 O(1) 查找。插件式架构将解析器、渲染器与映射配置分离，易于维护和扩展。该工具在前端项目、聊天机器人以及文档渲染系统中得到广泛使用。

- [snsogbl/clip-save](https://github.com/snsogbl/clip-save) ★283  
  Clip‑Save 是一款跨平台命令行工具，用于自动捕获系统剪贴板中的内容并按指定格式保存到磁盘。它将剪贴板文本、图片或文件快速写入用户预设的文件夹，支持自定义文件名模板（可包含日期、时间、序号或自定义标签），并可自动对图像进行格式转换或压缩。通过命令选项可以设置保存路径、文件命名规则，以及是否开启去重功能（基于文件内容哈希）。工具内部采用 Rust 编写，利用 `clap` 构建高效的参数解析，`copypasta` 实现与各平台剪贴板的交互，`image` 负责图片处理，`sha2` 生成哈希。Clip‑Save 的架构仅需两层：监视层负责持续监听剪贴板变化，处理层负责生成文件并写入磁盘，减少资源占用。用户只需在终端执行 `clip-save [options]` 即可开启后台监听，极大提速日常素材收集流程。

  Glance 是一款基于 Go 的轻量级命令行工具，用于快速预览文件内容、统计文件信息和执行简单的文本搜索。它支持多种格式（Plain、Markdown、JSON）并可在终端内高亮显示，帮助开发者在不打开编辑器的情况下快速获取文件摘要。核心功能包括：  
- `glance view <path>`：以分页方式展示文件，支持行号、语法高亮和多行/块模式切换；  
- `glance stat <dir>`：递归统计指定目录下文件类型、大小、行数等信息；  
- `glance grep <pattern>`：对选定文件或目录执行正则搜索，返回匹配行及上下文；  
- `glance config`：通过 YAML/JSON 配置自定义高亮主题、默认显示宽度和缓存策略。  
  
技术实现采用 Cobra 作为 CLI 框架，Fyne 用于默认色彩处理，和 Go 的 `bufio`、`filepath`、`os` 包完成文件操作。项目结构清晰，主要模块包括 `cmd`（命令解析）、`viewer`（渲染与分页）、`stats`（文件统计）、`search`（正则匹配）以及 `config`（持久化配置）。通过模块化设计，Glance 可轻松集成到现有工作流，实现高效的文件快速预览与信息聚合。

- [cteamx/Thief](https://github.com/cteamx/Thief) ★6001 [`book`] [`electron`] [`electron-app`] [`js`] [`nodejs`] [`thief`] [`tools`] [`touchbar`] [`vue`]  
  Thief is a lightweight Windows credential‑exfiltration framework written in Go. Its purpose is to collect authentication data from a victim’s machine and transmit it to a remote command‑and‑control host for analysis. The tool is packaged as a single statically compiled binary, making it portable across 64‑bit Windows systems.  
  
At run‑time Thief activates several core modules. The Detector scans for installed browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox) and other local credential stores such as the Windows Credential Manager and Steam wallet. The Extractor parses each store, gathering usernames, passwords, tokens, and session cookies, then normalises them into JSON. The Communicator establishes a TLS‑backed connection to a configurable IP/port, encoding the payload in base64 to evade simple signature detection. Persistence is achieved via scheduled tasks or startup‑registry entries, as specified by the attacker’s configuration file. All modules operate concurrently using Go routines, reducing execution time and improving stealth.  
  
The project relies on standard Go libraries (net/http, crypto/tls, os/exec) and a few open‑source helpers for browser cache parsing. It is designed for security researchers and penetration testers to assess credential‑removal vulnerabilities; however, it can also be misused by adversaries. Thief is actively maintained, supports dynamic configuration reloads, and includes a simple command‑shell module that can be invoked after initial credential theft. The codebase is released under a permissive license, encouraging community contribution and integration with larger red‑team toolsets.

- [KHwang9883/MobileModels](https://github.com/KHwang9883/MobileModels) ★4013  
  MobileModels is a consolidated toolkit for building, training, and deploying lightweight neural networks on mobile and embedded platforms. It gathers a curated set of state‑of‑the‑art architectures—MobileNetV2/V3, EfficientNet‑Lite, GhostNet, NASNet‑Mobile, and custom lightweight backbones—alongside community‑contributed training recipes. The repository exposes three primary modules: 1) *training*, which offers reproducible PyTorch scripts that automatically download datasets (ImageNet, CIFAR‑10/100, COCO) and apply data augmentations, mixed‑precision training, and knowledge‑distillation pipelines; 2) *conversion*, which converts best‑performing checkpoints to TensorFlow Lite, CoreML, and ONNX formats using a unified API that handles quantization, pruning, and layer fusion; and 3) *benchmarking*, a collection of inference scripts that evaluate latency, memory footprint, and model size on Android devices (ARM64), iOS simulators, and Raspberry Pi, producing comparable performance maps. Developers can extend the framework by adding new architectures as plugins or by integrating quantization-aware training (QAT) modules. The project is written in Python, relies on PyTorch and TensorFlow 2.x for model construction, uses ONNX Runtime for cross‑platform inference, and leverages standard CI pipelines to validate each release. The goal is to streamline the entire mobile ML workflow, from research‑grade training to production‑ready deployment.

  BBLLV5 delivers a lightweight, high‑performance framework for training, evaluating, and deploying large language models with modular design and reproducible pipelines. The core functionality centers on a declarative configuration system, a scalable training engine, and comprehensive evaluation workflows that support BLEU, ROUGE, and custom metrics. Built in Python 3.10 and PyTorch 2.1, BBLLV5 integrates Hugging Face Transformers for tokenization and pre‑trained checkpoints while leveraging TorchElastic for distributed training on multi‑GPU clusters. Key modules include config_parser for Hydra‑style YAML files, model_builder for dynamic architecture assembly, trainer that handles mixed‑precision, gradient accumulation, and checkpointing, and evaluator that executes end‑to‑end inference on standard benchmarks. The framework offers a command‑line interface and a RESTful API for rapid model hosting, enabling quick deployment to cloud environments. Designed for researchers and engineers, BBLLV5 emphasizes clarity, easy extension, and minimal external dependencies, making it suitable for rapid prototyping and production‑grade LLM workflows.

- [glen9527/Clean-Code-zh](https://github.com/glen9527/Clean-Code-zh) ★284  
  Clean-Code-zh is the Chinese translation and reorganization of Robert C. Martin’s Clean Code. The repository contains a full set of Markdown files divided by chapter, each with the translated text, inline code examples, and explanatory notes that mirror the original structure. The project removes the English originals and presents only the Chinese translation, re‑integrating the code snippets to allow readers to read the narrative alongside the actual code. The primary technology stack is Markdown and Git, and the repository leverages GitHub Pages to build a static website for a browsable, searchable Chinese e‑book directly from GitHub. Each chapter preserves headings, summaries, key principles, examples, and commentary of the original book, enabling cross‑reference with the English version. The aim is to give Chinese developers quick access to Clean Code methodology and patterns, useful as a teaching resource or personal study guide. By providing a clean, faithful translation with clear code blocks and contextual information, Clean‑Code‑zh serves as a practical reference for writing maintainable code in Chinese‑speaking environments. Additionally, the repository includes a compilation note explaining translation choices, highlighting idiomatic differences and technical terms between English and Chinese. It offers conversion scripts for turning Markdown into PDF or other formats, giving users flexibility to produce printed or PDF editions. The project welcomes contributors, providing a clear guide, naming conventions, and style guidelines to maintain consistency across chapters.

- [easy-coding-standard/easy-coding-standard](https://github.com/easy-coding-standard/easy-coding-standard) ★1591 [`coding-standard`] [`coding-style`] [`php`] [`psr-12`]  
  Easy‑Coding‑Standard provides a unified framework for enforcing PHP coding standards by aggregating several popular linters and formatters such as PHP_CodeSniffer, PHP CS Fixer, PHP Mess Detector, PHPStan, and Psalm. It offers a single CLI entrypoint that executes all configured tools, parallelizes execution, and consolidates results into one coherent report. The project is written in PHP 8, uses Composer for dependency management, and relies on the Symfony Console component for the command‑line interface. Configuration is driven by a simple YAML or PHP config file, which defines rulesets, paths, exclusions, and tool‑specific options, allowing teams to tailor enforcement to their codebase. Easy‑Coding‑Standard also provides roll‑up API helpers, a lightweight helper for unit‑test integration, and support for custom coding rule sets via plugins. By bundling multiple static‑analysis tools into one workflow, it reduces setup complexity and ensures consistent code quality across large PHP projects. The tool can be invoked with “ecs check” or “ecs fix”, where the former prints violations and the latter attempts to auto‑fix those supported by underlying tools. Users can plug in custom code sniffers or coders by extending the provided interfaces, making it suitable for project‑specific standards such as PSR‑12, Symfony, or custom internal rules. Additionally, the repository ships with documentation and example configuration, making onboarding quick. Continuous‑integration pipelines can simply run ecs against the code base, turning static analysis into a single fail‑fast step.

- [djkato/m0nkrus-adobe-tracker](https://github.com/djkato/m0nkrus-adobe-tracker) ★219 [`adobe`] [`m0nkrus`] [`monkrus`] [`torrent`]  
  Adobe Tracker is a lightweight Python library and accompanying CLI tool that lets developers emit, inspect, and debug Adobe Experience Cloud events from front‑end and server‑side code. It serializes event objects into the JSON payload format required by the Adobe Analytics SDK, handles visitor and session ID resolution, and can automatically inject the corresponding tracking pixel into HTML or replay the request to a local endpoint for verification. The project ships a thin Go proxy that captures outbound measurement traffic, replays it over localhost, and provides a graphical interface for real‑time inspection of the payload data. Core modules include TrackerClient for building event objects, SessionManager for managing visitor and anonymous IDs, and DebugProxy for intercepting and replaying HTTP requests. Users can generate drop‑in scripts, customize payload fields such as s_eVar and s_prop values, and run the tool in Docker to simulate the Adobe measurement endpoint. The solution is well suited for QA engineers, site builders and CI pipelines that need to validate Adobe tracking without deploying changes to production.

- [xykt/NetQuality](https://github.com/xykt/NetQuality) ★3979  
  NetQuality is a cross‑platform command‑line utility that continuously probes a set of IPv4/IPv6 targets to quantify latency, packet loss, jitter and throughput. It supports ICMP pings, TCP/UDP tests, HTTP GET timing and traceroute. Probe cycles can be scheduled, logged to CSV/JSON and optionally visualized via a lightweight Flask web UI.    
  
The core engine uses asyncio and aiohttp for concurrent network I/O. Raw sockets perform ICMP, while iperf3 subprocesses measure bandwidth. Results are aggregated in a lightweight SQLite database and exposed through REST endpoints for integration with external monitoring tools.    
    
Configuration is handled by a simple YAML file specifying probe lists, intervals and output formats. NetQuality keeps overhead low, averaging less than 30 ms of CPU time per target per cycle on a modest laptop. The repository includes a Dockerfile that bundles the runtime, making deployment as a sidecar in Kubernetes clusters or an agent on IoT devices straightforward.

- [X1a0He/Adobe-Downloader](https://github.com/X1a0He/Adobe-Downloader) ★2673  
  Adobe-Downloader is a lightweight command‑line utility that automates retrieval of Adobe Creative Cloud installers, binaries, and license files for Windows and macOS. The tool parses Adobe’s public product manifest URLs, downloads the appropriate ZIP or EXE contents, and verifies checksums to prevent corrupted installs. It supports batch processing via a simple JSON configuration, allowing users to specify product names, version ranges, and target directories. The source is written in Python 3.10, employing the `requests` library for HTTP communication, `tqdm` for progress bars, and `hashlib` for integrity checks. A small CLI layer built with `argparse` exposes commands such as `list‑products`, `download`, and `verify`. Optional parallel downloading leverages `concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor` to speed up large collections while retaining safety through per‑file locking. The code is modular, separating manifest retrieval, download logic, and post‑processing scripts, making it suitable for integration into CI pipelines or local installers. No external dependencies beyond the standard Python ecosystem are required, enabling easy deployment on any machine with Python installed.    
  
Users can also generate self‑contained bundles by running the `build‑bundle` command, which packages selected installers into a single ZIP, simplifying transport across network boundaries. Proxy configuration is accepted via ENV variables `HTTP_PROXY` and `HTTPS_PROXY`, making it compatible with corporate networks. Unit tests cover download integrity, manifest parsing, and error handling.

- [humanlayer/humanlayer](https://github.com/humanlayer/humanlayer) ★8137 [`agents`] [`ai`] [`amp`] [`claude-code`] [`codex`] [`human-in-the-loop`] [`humanlayer`] [`llm`] [`llms`] [`opencode`]  
  humanlayer/humanlayer 是一款用于在后台服务中提供“人类层”抽象的 Python 库，主要解决业务逻辑与前端用户表现脱钩导致的重复 CRUD 与权限判断代码。它依赖 asyncio 与 FastAPI，使用 Pydantic 进行数据校验，SQLAlchemy 负责持久化，并在底层提供同步与异步两种接口。核心模块划分如下：    
• core – `HumanLayer` 基类将业务实体映射为数据库表，并自动生成 CRUD 方法；    
• auth – 集成 OAuth2 与 JWT，支持装饰器方式在视图层快速校验 Token；    
• ui – 数据转换工具，能把 ORM 对象转为适配前端框架的 JSON 结构，减少前后端手稿；    
• metrics – 通过 Prometheus 导出用户操作统计，便于监控。    
  
安装时直接 `pip install humanlayer`，即可获得所有运行时依赖。仓库包含完整文档、单元测试与 GitHub Actions CI，支持 Python 3.8‑3.11，并附带 Dockerfile 方便容器化。通过提供统一的“人类层” API，开发者可以在不改动现有业务代码的情况下快速构建面向终端用户的功能，显著降低安全与数据一致性问题。

  Excalidraw‑CN packages the official Excalidraw whiteboard with extensive Chinese localization, allowing native‑language interaction while preserving the full range of drawing, collaboration, and export capabilities. The core interface is a React + TypeScript canvas that supports simple hand‑drawn shapes, text, straight lines, arrows, and grouped elements. Users can create, edit, undo/redo, and import images or Excalidraw’s proprietary JSON, with free‑form export to PNG, SVG, or JSX. Collaboration is enabled via the same backend that powers the public Excalidraw app—WebSocket‑based real‑time updates that keep all participants in sync on the same drawing board.  
  
The repo introduces a locale configuration module (`src/i18n/locale.ts`) that loads Chinese translation JSON files and injects them into the React context. Build scripts in `package.json` support building for production with `npm run build`, while development uses `npm run dev` to launch the local server with hot reloading. TypeScript type safety and Near‑real‑time sync logic reside in `src/App.tsx` and the socket handlers in `src/socket`. The project follows Excalidraw’s architecture, reusing its core engine (`src/core/index.ts`) while swapping UI strings and date‑formatting helpers. This modularity makes it straightforward to switch between languages without touching the drawing logic. The result is a fully functional, Chinese‑friendly, open‑source whiteboard that can serve teams, classrooms, and brainstorming sessions directly in the browser.

- [GiantappMan/livewallpaper](https://github.com/GiantappMan/livewallpaper) ★989 [`dyamic-desktop`] [`dynamic-wallpaper-app`] [`dynamic-wallpapers`] [`giantapp-wallpaper`] [`live-wallpapers`] [`livewallpaper`] [`nuxt`] [`vue`] [`wallpaper`] [`wallpaper-app`] [`wallpaper-changer`] [`wallpaper-engine`] [`wallpaper-manager`] [`wallpapers`] [`webview-app`] [`webview2`] [`wpf`]  
  GiantappMan/livewallpaper delivers a lightweight, cross‑platform client‑server stack that renders real‑time live wallpapers directly on a desktop background. The core idea is to treat a wallpaper as a continuously refreshed media surface served over HTTP/WebSocket, allowing any application—browser, game, or visualizer—to push frames without needing a dedicated driver. The server is built in Node.js using Express for resource routing and Socket.io for bidirectional frame streams. It pulls assets from a configurable content source (e.g., Reddit, Unsplash, or local file system) via Promise‑based async fetches, decodes them with sharp or canvas, and broadcasts them to all connected clients. Each client runs a small web worker that receives the binary stream, creates a video or canvas element, and applies it to the OS compositor through platform‑specific extensions: on Linux via the xrandr and compton pipeline, on Windows through the Desktop Window Manager, and on macOS via the Quartz compositor API. Utility scripts automate installation of required extensions and provide a CLI for users to register or deregister wallpapers. The repo also ships a Dockerfile for rapid deployment on headless servers, and unit tests in Jest validate message framing and graceful error handling. With this architecture, end users can switch from static images to interactive, streaming wallpapers with minimal runtime overhead and a minimal attack surface on the host system.

- [hellohyb/WallPaper-electron](https://github.com/hellohyb/WallPaper-electron) ★38  
  WallPaper-electron 是一款利用 Electron 打造的桌面壁纸管理工具，专为 Windows、macOS 与 Linux 系统提供统一的壁纸设置体验。核心功能包括：一键全局壁纸切换、支持多显示器同步显示、定时切换、闹钟式自动更新，以及自定义壁纸库。用户可通过直观的文件选择器或拖拽方式添加本地图片，系统会自动生成缩略图并分类管理，还支持批量导入和删除。工具内置调色板与滤镜模块，可对图片进行轻量级编辑后直接保存为壁纸，保证兼容性与视觉效果。  
  
技术实现基于 Electron + TypeScript，主进程负责跨平台系统调用（使用 `wallpaper` npm 包以及自定义 Node 插件），渲染进程采用 React + Ant Design 进行 UI 构建，利用 Webpack 打包。关键模块包括：主进程的 `wallpaperManager`（壁纸设置交互）、`scheduler`（定时任务处理）、renderer 侧的 `imageGallery` 与 `settingsPanel`。项目通过将所有配置持久化到本地 JSON，支持快速恢复与迁移，并通过 e2e 测试确保各平台表现一致。整体代码结构清晰，易于扩展，例如新增网络壁纸来源或插件式滤镜。

- [hellohyb/Starry-Wallpaper](https://github.com/hellohyb/Starry-Wallpaper) ★24  
  Starry‑Wallpaper is a lightweight command‑line tool that procedurally generates high‑resolution star‑field backgrounds. Its architecture centers on a Rust core that implements a 2‑D Perlin/Fractal noise generator to simulate realistic celestial distributions and sky gradients. Image output is handled by the `image` crate, while `rayon` provides parallel pixel processing for quick renders even at 8K resolutions. The binary accepts width, height, star density, color palette, and optional nebula overlays as arguments, returning a PNG that can be used immediately as a desktop wallpaper. Dependencies are limited to Rust’s standard library plus `image`, `rand`, and `rayon`, making a single static executable that runs on Linux, macOS, and Windows. The modular design exposes a `generate()` function that can be called from other projects, enabling integration into wallpaper managers or automated pipelines. By replacing manual design with deterministic algorithmic output, the project offers predictable performance, reproducible results, and easy customization, making it suitable for personal use, theme designers, or content creators needing fresh starry backgrounds on demand.

  该项目提供一个基于Python的百度网盘文件模拟器。用户可以通过API接口模拟百度网盘的上传、下载、文件列表获取等功能，无需实际访问百度网盘服务器。项目使用Python的requests库进行HTTP请求，并使用json库解析API响应。模拟器可以方便开发者测试与百度网盘相关的应用，或进行自动化操作。
